page.title: 11THE CHILBRIDGE FARM
page.content: {HISTORY There is much evidence of human activity across the farm starting from the early iron age through Roman occupation to the middle ages and considerable excavations have been recorded over the years. {LANDUSE The land is loam over chalk,with clay on higher ground,originally used for sheep farming until{1940.}The 1313 acres of {Richards}property are intensively farmed as follows: {CHILBRIDGE }600 acres, 200 wheat (main office) 400 barley. processed for feedstock. 600 acres grass 80% dairy {CATTLE } 20% calves 3 million litres milk produced p.a.
